title: NASA and DARPA select Lockheed Martin to develop DRACO nuclear propulsion demo
summary: NASA and DARPA have selected Lockheed Martin to develop a spacecraft to demonstrate nuclear propulsion technologies in Earth orbit later this decade.

title: Space Command nominee: U.S. has to prepare to respond to aggression against satellites
summary: The U.S. military is being challenged to counter China’s rapid advances in space technology, Lt. Gen. Stephen Whiting told the Senate Armed Services Committee July 26.

title: The US government is taking a serious step toward space-based nuclear propulsion
summary: "NASA is looking to go to Mars with this system."

title: NASA Awards $14 Million to Universities for Supportive STEM Efforts
summary: NASA is investing more than $14 million in 19 U.S. colleges and universities to grow their STEM capacity to participate in critical spaceflight research and prepare a new generation of diverse students for careers in the nation's science, technology, engineering, and math workforce.

title: Falcon Heavy to launch largest ever geostationary satellite
summary: Ahead of what will be its third flight this year, Falcon Heavy is being prepared for the record-breaking launch of EchoStar 24. Also known as Jupiter 3, this payload will be the heaviest satellite launched to a geostationary transfer orbit, massing 9.2 tonnes. As such, Falcon Heavy will need to expend its center core to gain additional performance, like what has been done on several recent missions.

title: ‘Non-Human Biologic’ Pilot Found Aboard Crashed UAP
summary: The US House Oversight Commitee held a historic hearing on Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena: Implications on National Security, Public Safety, and Government Transparency.

title: Boeing’s Starliner losses total $1.5 billion with NASA astronauts still waiting to fly
summary: Boeing on Wednesday reported a $257 million charge in the second quarter for its Starliner astronaut spacecraft program, bringing the program’s to-date overrun costs to $1.5 billion as delays continue.

title: Boeing records more losses from Starliner delays
summary: Boeing took another loss on its CST-100 Starliner commercial crew program as the first crewed flight of that vehicle remains in limbo.

title: US Space Force To Develop Commercial Space Reserve
summary: The United States Space Force is advancing plans to establish a Commercial Augmentation Space Reserve (CASR) program. The initiative aims to secure agreements with commercial space companies, ensuring prioritized access to critical satellite services like communication and remote sensing during times of national security emergencies.

title: NASA & DARAP Select Lockheed Martin To Develop Nuclear Rocket
summary: NASA and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) have partnered together for the Demonstration Rocket for Agile Cislunar Operations (DRACO) program. Today they have revealed Lockheed Martin, based in Littleton, Colorado, has been selected as the prime contractor for the design, build, and testing of the revolutionary nuclear-powered rocket.
